context: The word 'läks' is the past tense singular form of the Estonian verb 'minema', which means 'to go'. It indicates movement away from the current location. In this case, it's used in the simple past tense (3rd person singular). The verb 'minema' can have different forms depending on the subject and tense: läksin (I went), läksid (you went/singular), läks (he/she/it went), lähme (we go/went), lähete (you go/went/plural), lähed (they go/went).
